meanings.definition: The property of being able to prevent others from using or accessing something.
meanings.sent1: The excludability of the password protected the sensitive information.
meanings.sent2: The excludability of the fence kept the intruders out of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The excludability of the VIP section made the regular attendees curious.
meanings.sent4: Her excludability in the group was like a fortress, impenetrable and secure.
meanings.sent5: The excludability of the lock was as strong as a steel barrier.

meanings.definition: The ability to exclude or keep out others from a certain area or resource.
meanings.sent1: The excludability of the bouncer ensured only invited guests entered the club.
meanings.sent2: The excludability of the barrier prevented unauthorized vehicles from entering.
meanings.sent3: The excludability of the umbrella during the rainstorm was comical.
meanings.sent4: His excludability in the game was like a shield, protecting his territory.
meanings.sent5: The excludability of the security system was as reliable as a loyal guard.
